definition: to talk cheerfully and wittily/to joke together
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: After pain leads wipe stem tears, still talk smiling breeze livings at the classmates in front.
sentences.chinese: 痛過之後，擦乾眼淚，在同學們面前依舊談笑風生。

sentences.english: They talk and laugh at a dinner table.
sentences.chinese: 他們在餐桌上談笑風生。

sentences.english: Talks and laughs merrily the conference for played the families to make the good impression.
sentences.chinese: 談笑風生的見面會給玩家們留下了良好的印象。

sentences.english: We talked and laughed cheerfully and toasted time and again in a very lively atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 人們談笑風生，推杯換盞，氣氛好不熱鬧。

sentences.english: He was in the office is busy profuse sweat, she is in and friends and laughing.
sentences.chinese: 他在辦公室忙得滿頭都是汗，她卻在和朋友談笑風生。

sentences.english: I try to read, I go to work, I'm laughing with my friends.
sentences.chinese: 我讀書努力，我工作勤奮，和朋友們談笑風生。

definition: free and unconstrained (idiom); unfettered/unbuttoned/without care or worries
to loiter (i.e. reluctant to leave)/to linger on
to talk endlessly/talking of anything under the sun
wind, flower, snow and moon, trite poetry subject (idiom); effete language without substance/love affair/romance is in the air/dissipated life
lit. isn't that a joy? (quote from Confucius)/fig. (jocularly) extremely/awfully
wine goblets and gambling chips lie intertwined/to drink and gamble together in a large group (idiom)/a big (drinking) party
